answers.answer: Hi-I don't have an answer for you, but I wanted to ask if you would please post here whatever you find out on this subject? I had gest diabetes with my last baby, now I'm ten weeks and I really don't want to go through that again. It was a loooong pregnancy, and my son weighed over 9lbs, and had to be poked numerous times to test his blood sugar...Is it possible to prevent it? That had never crossed my mind until I read your post, I just accepted the fact that I would more than likely have it again.Please let me know anything you find out, and I will ask my Dr. and others and let you know too.April

hi nice to meet other moms who have had GD !!  Yes, I am getting some positive information on Preventing Gestational Diabetes.I encourage you to go to Plus-size-pregnancy.org and look up the main index.  On the main index page, it has a link called "All about Gestational Diabetes"  I was so excited when I found it. This mom that wrote it had GD in one pregnancy and went on to have 3 more pregnancies without GD,  she has done HUGE amounts of research and posted it there along with what she did to prevent it.  But I think she started BEFORE pregnancy.  Don't give up though.  The main keys are according to her are a diet change, exersise, and not gaining too much weight??  Anyway I would just encourage you to look it upI also found a study done on preventing gest. Diab. I am not sure of the link.  BUt if you click on "fiber prevents gestational diabetes"  in your search web box you should find it pretty easy.I am realizing that even though I may change my lifesylye and habits completely to prevent GD it still could possibly come back, but we are a higher risk for Diabetes type 2 later in life, so the diet and exersise will defently help that in the long run.Have a great day!!

i dont think its possible to prevent, sometimes its just hereditary and there are other factors like age, weight and if its a multiple pregnancy that influence your chances of getting it.It may help to watch your weight gain, but again, i dont know if thats going to guarantee anything. I have a cousin who weighs 115 at the most and she had it with all three of her pregnancies...

I had GD with my 1st pg and not iwth my second.  What I did was when I found out I was pg I modified my eating habits to cut out a lot of simple carbs your white flours, sugars in mayn foods and such--Try and stick to complex carbs and it should help.  I don't know why they induced you so early with all the tests being good--I was induced a week over that is as long as they say you should go--either natural or by one week induction.  Both of my boys were a over 8 1/2lbs but I only gained 17 lbs each time.  I failed both 1 hrs but onthe second pg I passed the three hour and think it was because I did cut back on carbs so early that my body did not have to digest my carb habit and the glucose test on the same day so I was able to pass.  I did not know this info when pg with my first.

THat is exciting that you did not have it in the seconed pregnancy.  I think mine came from my terrible SUGAR habit.  Before I got married, I would go into the bathroom and sneak 9 cookies at a time and eat them as fast as I could, and I was only 155 lbs and 5'6"  I know that was terrible now I am paying for it.Has anyone heard of the Brewer diet.  Midwives say this prevents gest. diabetes, pre-eclamp. and other complications in pregnancy.  Thelarge amount ot protein keeps blood sugars stable

I had gd w/ my 2nd pregnancy but not my 1st.  during the 2nd pregnancy I really didnt watch what i ate and i did eat some dumb stuff like gummy bears and ice cream and chocolate.  sometimes i did eat a lot of it.  Next pregnancy I am going to be a lot more cautious about eating better.  Not to mention that I gained a lot of weight.

question: Hi.. I am 24 and have had 3 children.  MY first preg. was borderline gest. diabetes, my seconed and third preg I was diagnosed with gest. diabetes.  My baby is almost 9 months old, and I am doing extensive research on what I can do to prevent gest. diab. in future pregnancies.  I was induced between 1 1/2 -2 weeks before my due date with all three babies.  The last one was only 6 lbs. 15 oz at 38 weeks.  I don't think he was ready to be born yet.  I had GOOD sugars most of the time,all of my many ultrasounds and NStests came back PERFECT.  Why couldn't my doc have waited till 40 weeks, as long as all the tests and sugars were good??  I want another docs opinion...I had major problems with breastfeeding also....and he had almost no desire to eat for weeks.I am natural minded and wonder another doctors take on this, and whether gest.diabetes can be prevented infuture pregnancies thank you so much!!
title: Had Gest. Diabetes twice can I prevent it again nrxt time??
